modules.description: This module provides functions for measuring and manipulating time, including retrieving the current time and converting between different time representations. It works with `float`, `int64`, and custom time types such as `span` and `t`. Concrete use cases include timing operations, implementing delays, and converting between seconds, milliseconds, and nanoseconds.

Implements lifecycle management operations for Unix domains, primarily providing `await_shutdown_request` to block until a shutdown signal is received. Works with Lwt threads and domain lifecycle events, allowing callers to specify supported shutdown modes like poweroff or reboot. Useful for coordinating graceful shutdowns in server applications or virtual machine monitors.

Implements the entry point for executing a MirageOS unikernel on Unix, providing the `run` function that starts the event loop and initializes the runtime environment. Works with Lwt threads and Unix-specific system resources like file descriptors, network interfaces, and process signals. Used to launch and manage the lifecycle of a Unix-based MirageOS application, including handling command-line arguments and system interrupts.

This module implements core runtime and system interaction capabilities for MirageOS unikernels on Unix. It provides lifecycle management with controlled shutdown handling, a main entry point for application execution and event loop initialization, and precise time measurement and conversion functions. It is used to build self-contained Unix-based MirageOS applications that can manage time, respond to system signals, and coordinate clean termination.
